newsitem.title: UK: ISMA says membership numbers dip in 1996.
newsitem.headline: ISMA says membership numbers dip in 1996.

text.p: International Securities Market Association (ISMA) membership fell in 1996 to 818 from 836 the previous year, it said in its annual report on Tuesday.
This fall reflected consolidation in the financial industry following mergers, takeovers and closures and was expected to continue, although at a slower pace, ISMA said.
ISMA would need to attract more members in emerging market economies to compensate for the decline of membership in the more mature financial centres, the report said.
ISMA currently has 819 members, including 39 associate members, from 48 countries.
